list_definition.definition: an animal with a lizard-like appearance, having short legs and a long tail, that lives both on land and in water

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Salamanders and newts are in the amphibian family.

list_ex_of_english: One salamander was severely affected with associated tissue changes, including accumulations of melanomacrophages.
Responses of ganglion cells to contrast steps in the light-adapted retina of the tiger salamander.
Passive electrical cable proper ties and synaptic excitation of tiger salamander retinal ganglion cells.
Taken together, we thought that it was important to investigate the number and spatial arrangement of major cell populations in the salamander retina.
The basis for this sustained current in tiger salamander retinal ganglion cells is unknown; perhaps it reflects a biphasic inactivation behavior of one channel type.
The spatial distribution of excitatory and inhibitory inputs to ganglion cell dendrites in the tiger salamander retina.
Cone photoreceptors respond to their own glutamate release in the tiger salamander.
These recordings are of special interest since they are apparently the first to be reported for the land-phase tiger salamander.
